title: Humanoid robot orders could explode in 2026: Goldman Sachs
summary: Jacqueline Du, head of China industrial tech research at Goldman Sachs, says that there is demand for humanoid robots even if they are not yet highly useful, and companies that are part of the supply chain are optimistic. She also says that there are different mindsets in China and the US regarding the commercialization of robots, and that while Chinese robotics firms are still highly reliant on Nvidia's Jetson Thor chips, it's likely that they will gradually shift towards domestic chips.

raw.headline: Humanoid robot orders could explode in 2026: Goldman Sachs
raw.summary: Jacqueline Du, head of China industrial tech research at Goldman Sachs, says that there is demand for humanoid robots even if they are not yet highly useful, and companies that are part of the supply chain are optimistic. She also says that there are different mindsets in China and the US regarding the commercialization of robots, and that while Chinese robotics firms are still highly reliant on Nvidia's Jetson Thor chips, it's likely that they will gradually shift towards domestic chips.

title: Taiwan raids former TSMC exec's homes in trade secrets probe
summary: STORY: Taiwan prosecutors said on Thursday investigators had raided the homes of a former senior TSMC executive and seized computers, after the company accused him of leaking trade secrets, which his current employer Intel has denied.TSMC said on Tuesday it had filed a lawsuit in Taiwan's Intellectual Property and Commercial Court against Wei-Jen Lo, its former senior vice president.:: SET TVTSMC is the world's largest contract chipmaker and major supplier to companies including Nvidia.:: TSMCTaiwan prosecutors' intellectual property branch said in a statement Lo is suspected of violating Taiwan's National Security Act.Lo did not immediately respond to a Reuters request for comment.:: Intel CorporationEarlier on Thursday, U.S. chipmaker Intel said in an emailed statement; "Based on everything we know, we have no reason to believe there is any merit to the allegations involving Mr Lo."Lo, helped drive TSMC's mass production of cutting-edge chips in a 21-year-long career there.Before that Lo was at Intel for 18 years. He re-joined Intel in October after retiring from TSMC.

raw.headline: Taiwan raids former TSMC exec's homes in trade secrets probe
raw.summary: STORY: Taiwan prosecutors said on Thursday investigators had raided the homes of a former senior TSMC executive and seized computers, after the company accused him of leaking trade secrets, which his current employer Intel has denied.TSMC said on Tuesday it had filed a lawsuit in Taiwan's Intellectual Property and Commercial Court against Wei-Jen Lo, its former senior vice president.:: SET TVTSMC is the world's largest contract chipmaker and major supplier to companies including Nvidia.:: TSMCTaiwan prosecutors' intellectual property branch said in a statement Lo is suspected of violating Taiwan's National Security Act.Lo did not immediately respond to a Reuters request for comment.:: Intel CorporationEarlier on Thursday, U.S. chipmaker Intel said in an emailed statement; "Based on everything we know, we have no reason to believe there is any merit to the allegations involving Mr Lo."Lo, helped drive TSMC's mass production of cutting-edge chips in a 21-year-long career there.Before that Lo was at Intel for 18 years. He re-joined Intel in October after retiring from TSMC.
